email.text: **IC Hack 19 Powered by Cisco** is only a few days away. We can't wait to see you there! In the meantime, we have some **key information** for you to go through, so be sure to read through this email carefully!

## Join Our Slack!
Join our Slack team using [this link](https://join.slack.com/t/ichack19/shared_invite/enQtNTEwNTA2OTAzODI0LWFjMWNkZTQyZDNjYTgxMTdhOTZlODNiNGZjYjc5MDI3YTdkYTVkYTc4MTRjM2QxMmFhZjA2NzUxN2Y3NzEzNzk). We use the Slack team to **make important announcements** (on the *#announcements* channel) and you can use the team to talk to organisers, sponsors and fellow hackers. Make sure you **join the team before the weekend** so you don't miss any important information.
Keep an eye on our sponsor (*#sp-[sponsor]*) channels to find out more about them and take part in their challenges. If you're looking for a team, be sure to join the *#team-forming* channel.

## Ticket Cancellations
As we have a very long waitlist, if you are unable to attend, please cancel your ticket [via Eventbrite](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/mytickets/) as soon as possible so your space can be released. If you are having difficulties doing so, you can email us at info@ichack.org. Please note that tickets are non-transferable.

## Equipment Requests
We're happy to provide our attendees with hardware/equipment for their hacks on a best-effort basis. If you have an idea which requires additional equipment, please send a short proposal to info@ichack.org detailing your idea and what equipment you require, and we'll do our best to provide you with what you need!

## What to Bring
On the day, be sure to have your Eventbrite ticket ready (either digital or printed - up to you!) and a **valid form of Government ID** (driving license or passport). Please note you must be **over 18** on the day of the event to attend.
Also don't forget to bring chargers for your devices (including your phone and laptop) to keep them powered on overnight. Bringing a warm coat is also recommended as some of our activities may involve going outdoors.

## Getting There
IC Hack is hosted at **Imperial College South Kensington Campus**. The registration will take place at the **main entrance** on Exhibition Road, SW7 2BX. The best way to reach the venue is via tube to South Kensington Station (District, Circle and Piccadilly lines), then either walking up the subway (exiting at the end of the subway and turning left) or up Exhibition Road.
Alternatively, you can take buses **9, 23, 52, 70, 452**, which stop opposite the Royal Albert Hall. The Imperial College main entrance is then a short, five-minute walk south from there. There are limited car parking spaces nearby, so we recommend using public transport.
**Registration starts from 10:00am**. Please **do not be late** as the Opening Ceremony starts at 10:45am!
Please be sure to bring a **valid form of Government ID** for admission, hardware loans and to be able to attend the _Drinks with PolyAI_ activity.
